etymology.description: semantic: 㕯(㕯) (to speak slowly) + phonetic: 章(章) (zhāng, "chapter") -> originally estimating inside from outside, evolved to commerce

examples.chinese: 他投身于商界(他投身於商界)。
examples.pinyin: tā tóu shēn yú shāng jiè.
examples.english: He devotes himself to the business world.

examples.chinese: 古代商贾往来频繁(古代商賈往來頻繁)，市井繁华似锦(市井繁華似錦)。
examples.pinyin: gǔdài shāng jiǎ wǎng lái pín fán, shì jǐng fán huá sì jǐn.
examples.english: In ancient times, merchants frequently traded, and the markets thrived brilliantly.

examples.chinese: 兴商有道者致富(興商有道者致富)。
examples.pinyin: xīng shāng yǒu dào zhě zhì fù.
examples.english: Those who engage in sound business practices prosper.
